results.title: Britain's new resources
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A brief study of the uses to which Britain is putting her limited natural resources; the harvesting, scientific drying, and storing of short grass for feeding cattle all the year round; the planting of forests and cutting of timber; harnessing of hydro-electric power; soap manufacture without fats; the use of seaweed in the manufacture of many products; production of magnesium from the waters of the North Sea.

results.title: Bristol: British city
results.creator_credit: Alexander Shaw, World Wide Pictures and Mary Francis
results.brief_description: The people of Bristol tell of their city, long since called the Maritime Capital of the West of England; a city with whose history many pioneers, adventurers and navigators, and many great moral and spiritual leaders have been associated. With its bustling life and half a million citizens, the city’s efficiency is still symbolised by the old phrase “shipshape and Bristol fashion”.

results.title: Bristol fashion
results.creator_credit: Terry Ashwood, Associated British-Pathe and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: The history and development of the Port of Bristol - the only major municipally owned port in Britain. Illustrates the facilities available in the city docks and at Avonmouth and Portishead, and discusses plans for the expansion of dock services. Sequences on the history of architecture of Bristol are interwoven.

results.title: Bright future...for some
results.brief_description: Third in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Examines the merchants’ reactions when they had to pay road, bridge, market and money exchange tolls to local landlords after riches began pouring in from Europe. Shows how they plotted with the king to stop this “exploitation” and were subsequently successful in having new laws passed in their favour, to the detriment of the peasants and craftsmen. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Briefing for health
results.brief_description: Indicates the dangers facing the female recruit when she joins the W.A.A.F. The ravages of venereal diseases are illustrated, with information on the avoidance of the disease and on measures to be taken if it is suspected that the disease has been contacted. No other credits available.

results.title: Briefing
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the problem of an individual receiving information from a group. Three executives are briefing a new designer and digress to such an extent that at the end of the briefing the designer still has to ask what the product was. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Bridgit
results.brief_description: The 32 minute work by Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger won the 2018 Turner Prize, and explores themes of class, gender, sexuality and neolithic goddesses.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.title: Bridging the learning gap
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of small discussion groups as the main teaching medium in the University’s Faculty of Law, and reasons for the adoption of the system. The role of the teacher in this teaching situation, and the extent to which objectives are being achieved are being evaluated by the T.E.R.C. Increasing student interest and involvement is apparent.

results.title: Bridging the highways
results.creator_credit: Dorman Long & Co and John Byrd
results.brief_description: Steel bridges put together on site from prefabricated universal sections mean a saving in labour and greater speed in bridge constructions. The sections are despatched ready for erection to numerous sites all over modern motorway Britain.

results.title: Bridging the gap
results.brief_description: Designed to help acquire and realise the vital skills of parent-child communications. Dr Thomas Gordon, a nationally recognised authority, discusses such needs as identity, honest recognition of feelings, and courageous action as new methods of communicating, in an attempt to establish a deeper, and more intimate, relationship between parent and child.
